user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtList_Destroy:
```c
void UtList_Destroy(UtListHead_t *ListHead)
{
    uint32 i;

    for (i = 0; i < ListHead->NumberOfTags; ++i)
    {
        UtList_Reset(&ListHead->Tags[i]);
    }
    free(ListHead);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
UtList_Reset(&ListHead->Tags[i]);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 1.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the expression &ListHead->Tags[i] uses only standard C operators (structure member access, array subscript, and address-of). There is no use of any compiler-specific language extension in this fragment.
